title: UI/UX Design
summary: Create intuitive, beautiful, and user-centered digital experiences focusing on visual design and overall user experience.

steps.title: Design Principles & Theory (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn fundamental design principles, visual hierarchy, color theory, typography, gestalt principles, and Laws of UX.

resources.title: The Design of Everyday Things - Summary

quiz.question: What is color theory?
options: Study of color relationships and psychology
quiz.explanation: Color theory informs effective color choices.

quiz.question: What is typography?
options: Art and technique of arranging type

quiz.question: What are Gestalt principles?
quiz.explanation: Gestalt explains pattern recognition and grouping.

quiz.question: What is the law of proximity?
options: Close elements are perceived as related

quiz.question: What is the golden ratio?
quiz.explanation: Golden ratio creates aesthetically pleasing layouts.

quiz.question: What is rule of thirds?
options: Dividing layout into 3x3 grid for balance
quiz.explanation: Rule of thirds guides focal point placement.

quiz.question: What is scale?
options: Size of elements relative to each other

steps.title: UX Research Fundamentals (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Master user research methods, user interviews, persona creation, journey mapping, usability testing, and A/B testing fundamentals.

quiz.question: What is a user persona?
quiz.explanation: Personas embody user goals and pain points.

quiz.question: What is a journey map?
options: Visualization of user experience over time
quiz.explanation: Journey maps show user touchpoints and emotions.

quiz.question: What is A/B testing?
options: Comparing two versions to see which performs better
quiz.explanation: A/B testing uses data to optimize design.

quiz.question: What is card sorting?
quiz.explanation: Card sorting reveals user mental models.

quiz.question: What is an empathy map?
options: Tool showing what users think, feel, say, do

quiz.question: What is task analysis?
options: Breaking down user actions into steps

steps.title: UI Design Basics (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Learn UI fundamentals including layout, composition, grid systems, spacing, alignment, button design, and form design best practices.

quiz.question: What is a button state?
quiz.explanation: States include default, hover, active, disabled.

quiz.question: What is form validation?
quiz.explanation: Validation prevents errors and guides users.

quiz.question: What is a layout?
quiz.explanation: Layouts define content hierarchy and flow.

quiz.question: What is Z-pattern?
options: Eye movement pattern for visual scanning

quiz.question: What is affordance?
options: Property suggesting how to use element

steps.title: Figma Mastery (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master Figma including basics, Auto Layout, components & variants, prototyping, design systems, and essential plugins.

quiz.question: What is Auto Layout?
quiz.explanation: Auto Layout adapts to content changes.

quiz.question: What is a design system?
options: Collection of reusable components and guidelines

quiz.question: What is a plugin?
quiz.explanation: Plugins automate tasks and enhance workflows.

quiz.question: What is vector editing?
quiz.explanation: Vectors maintain quality at any size.

quiz.question: What are styles?
options: Reusable color, text, and effect settings

quiz.question: What is branching?
options: Creating design file versions for exploration

quiz.question: What is version history?
options: Record of file changes over time

quiz.question: What is inspect panel?
options: Tool showing design specs for developers

steps.title: Other Design Tools (2-3 weeks)
steps.description: Explore Adobe XD, Sketch, and prototyping tools like ProtoPie, Principle, and Framer.

quiz.question: What is Adobe XD?
options: Design and prototyping tool by Adobe
quiz.explanation: XD integrates with Adobe Creative Cloud.

quiz.question: What is Sketch?
quiz.explanation: Sketch is popular for UI/UX design.

quiz.question: What is Framer?
quiz.explanation: Framer uses React for advanced prototypes.

steps.title: User Experience Design (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master information architecture, card sorting, wireframing, prototyping, usability testing, and accessibility (WCAG guidelines).

quiz.question: What is information architecture?
quiz.explanation: IA helps users find information easily.

quiz.question: What is a user flow?
options: Path users take to complete task

quiz.question: What is wireframing?
quiz.explanation: Wireframes focus on structure, not visuals.

quiz.question: What is accessibility?
options: Designing for all users including disabilities

quiz.question: What is color contrast?
options: Difference between text and background colors

quiz.question: What is screen reader?
options: Tool that reads content aloud for blind users
quiz.explanation: Screen readers enable blind users to navigate.

quiz.question: What is alt text?
quiz.explanation: Alt text helps screen reader users.

quiz.question: What is keyboard navigation?
quiz.explanation: Keyboard access is essential for accessibility.

quiz.question: What are navigation patterns?
options: Common ways users move through sites

quiz.question: What is search functionality?
options: Feature allowing users to find content

quiz.question: What is filtering?
quiz.explanation: Filtering helps users find relevant items.

quiz.question: What are ARIA labels?
quiz.explanation: ARIA labels improve screen reader support.

steps.title: Visual Design & Branding (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Learn color psychology, palette generation, typography pairing, logo design, brand identity, and design systems.

quiz.question: What is Material Design?
quiz.explanation: Material Design guides Android and web design.

quiz.question: What is HIG?
quiz.explanation: HIG defines iOS and macOS design standards.

quiz.question: What is a color palette?
options: Selected colors for brand or design

quiz.question: What is iconography?
options: Visual symbols representing actions or concepts

quiz.question: What is brand voice?
options: Tone and style of brand communication

quiz.question: What is monochromatic?
options: Color scheme using shades of one color

quiz.question: What are triadic colors?
options: Three evenly spaced colors on wheel

steps.title: Micro-interactions & Animation (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Master micro-interactions, animation principles, motion design, Lottie animations, and Smart Animate in Figma.

quiz.question: What is a hover state?
options: Visual change when cursor over element

steps.title: Responsive & Mobile Design (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn responsive web design, mobile-first approach, breakpoints, touch targets, and mobile app design patterns.

quiz.question: What is responsive design?
options: Design adapting to different screen sizes
quiz.explanation: Responsive design works on all devices.

quiz.question: What is a touch target?
quiz.explanation: Touch targets must be large enough for fingers.

quiz.question: What is a hamburger menu?
quiz.explanation: Hamburger menus save mobile screen space.

quiz.question: What is thumb zone?
options: Easily reachable area on mobile screen
quiz.explanation: Thumb zone guides mobile UI placement.

quiz.question: What are media queries?
options: CSS rules for different screen sizes

quiz.question: What's difference between tap and click?
options: Tap is touch, click is mouse
quiz.explanation: Tap and click require different design.

quiz.question: What is pull to refresh?
quiz.explanation: Pull to refresh is mobile pattern.

quiz.question: What is bottom navigation?
options: Menu at screen bottom for thumb access

steps.title: Design Systems & Testing (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master building design systems, component libraries, design tokens, user testing methods, analytics, and design handoff to developers.

quiz.question: What is a design system?
options: Collection of reusable components and standards
quiz.explanation: Design systems ensure consistency at scale.

quiz.question: What is Figma Dev Mode?
quiz.explanation: Dev Mode provides specs and code.

quiz.question: What is A/B testing?
quiz.explanation: A/B testing optimizes based on data.

quiz.question: What is atomic design?
options: Methodology building from atoms to pages

projects.title: Mobile App Landing Page Redesign
projects.description: Redesign a landing page for a mobile app focusing on clear value proposition, user-friendly layout, and conversion optimization.
tasks: Add compelling CTAs and hero section

projects.title: E-Commerce Checkout Flow
projects.description: Design a seamless checkout experience for an e-commerce website with user research, wireframes, prototypes, and usability testing.

projects.title: SaaS Dashboard Redesign
projects.description: Redesign a complex SaaS dashboard with focus on data visualization, information hierarchy, and user workflows.
tasks: Audit existing dashboard and identify pain points
Define key metrics and user goals

projects.title: Mobile Banking App
projects.description: Design a complete mobile banking application with user research, accessibility considerations, secure authentication, and comprehensive features.
tasks: Conduct competitive analysis of banking apps
Perform user research and create personas
Map out user journeys for key features
Create account overview and transaction history

projects.title: Cross-Platform Design System
projects.description: Create a comprehensive, scalable design system for web and mobile applications with components, patterns, guidelines, and developer documentation.
tasks: Research and audit existing UI components
Create patterns for common use cases
Design for multiple platforms (web, iOS, Android)
Set up version control for design system
Train team on design system usage
